SENT.plain: Two cases of well-known syndrome due to midbrain-brain stem hemorrhage without having a history of hypertension were reported
Case 1 is a 62-year-old female, presenting Weber's syndrome due to midbrain hemorrhage and diagnosed as Moyamoya disease angiographically

Case 2 is a 24-year-old-male, presenting One and a half syndrome due to brain stem hemorrhage from a brain stem cavernous angioma, which was diagnosed angiographically and by magnetic resonance imaging (MRI)
Left hemiparesis seen in case 1 had improved by conservative therapy but no improvement could be obtained in the oculomotor nerve palsy
In case 2, hematoma was aspirated surgically for the purpose of decompression and his neurological symptoms improved markedly
Their pathogenesis and pathophysiology were also discussed
